paper_abstract: Conventional hat feeds have the best performance in very deep reflector antennas because of their wide beamwidth. They also have the advantage of being self-supported. The disadvantage of this type of feed is its wide beamwidth. To solve this problem, a new hat feed is proposed that can be used as prime-focus feed for Fresnel zone plate antennas. The novel design, called parabolic hat feed is achieved by appropriate shaping of the hat feed profile. (c) 2008 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Int J RF and Microwave CAE 19: 416-422, 2009.
paper_title: Analysis and Design of a Novel Hat Feed with Narrow Beamwidth for the Fresnel Zone Plate Antenna
